newsitem.title: FRANCE: French cabinet on holiday until August 20.
newsitem.headline: French cabinet on holiday until August 20.

text.p: France's Socialist-led government began a summer break on Wednesday and will hold a next cabinet meeting on August 20, devoted mainly to discussing legislation to stimulate youth employment.
Government spokeswoman Catherine Trautmann told reporters that the cabinet would also discuss "urgent social and economic measures and a bill concerning conscription" at the August 20 meeting.
Prime Minister Lionel Jospin told reporters after the final cabinet meeting that he would leave on holiday for "a few days, but very little time".
"For the moment we are working. The issue is not when I leave, but when I come back," Jospin told reporters.
